item.title: 8 Sega Games With The Best Ranged Combat, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Sega has developed several iconic video games with a focus on engaging ranged combat gameplay.
  • Some Sega games, like Space Harrier and Rez, offer a unique blend of shooting action and entertainment.
  • Titles like Virtua Cop 2 showcase Sega's legacy in arcade rail shooters, providing players with a challenging gaming experience.

Sega is one of the most popular video game companies around, with the company delving into the hardware business at one point before abandoning this approach and sticking to publishing and developing software instead. During their long tenure in the industry, Sega has played a role in aiding the development of several incredible games.

Some of the best video games by Sega feature ranged combat that fans will have a great time with. Shooting down opponents and maneuvering skillfully to avoid damage is a huge part of what makes these games so special.

8 Space Harrier

A Tough Rail Shooter With Charming Visuals

  • Platforms: Arcade, Sega Mark III, Master System, Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Game Boy Advance, Game Gear, PC, PlayStation 2, Sega 32X, Sega Saturn, Virtual Console, X68000, ZX Spectrum
  • Release Date: October 2, 1985
  • Developer : Sega
  • Genre : Rail Shooter

A classic arcade game that fans love to this day, Space Harrier is a fun and challenging title where players must go through numerous stages and shoot up the bosses that stand in their way. The gameplay is simple yet engaging enough to keep fans glued to the arcade screens for a while.

Moving around deftly is important in this game if players don't want to be shot down to bits in no time. This is easier said than done, but all it takes is a few playthroughs for players to get the hang of Space Harrier and amass an impressive high score in no time.

7 Condemned 2: Bloodshot

While The Improvements Made To Ranged Combat Are Great, It Comes At The Cost Of The Game's Horrific Atmosphere

The first Condemned game wowed many fans with its creepy atmosphere and impressive melee combat. Fans wanted more from the sequel, but Condemned 2: Bloodshot decided to adopt an action-oriented approach instead, giving players more options to take out their foes with both their fists and weapons.

Most people felt that the game was too generous with its use of firearms, but players who want to enjoy the best of both melee and ranged combat will have a blast with Condemned 2: Bloodshot . As long as players aren't looking for a horror game first, they should have a fun time messing around with the combat mechanics of this title.

6 Rez

A Rail Shooter With A Focus On Rhythm Combat

A unique combination of the musical and shoot-'em-up genre, the beautiful visuals of Rez coupled with its unique gameplay loop makes it clear why this title has been updated numerous times for updated hardware. It's a simple yet engaging game that fans will have a great time with.

Players launch projectiles to the beat of the rhythm and take out the many obstacles standing in their way. It's a huge part of what makes Rez so special and ensures that players will have a great time with this striking rhythm title.

5 Alien: Isolation

Ranged Combat Is Just One Of The Many Ways Players Can Deal With Enemies

Alien: Isolation was a great surprise that excited many fans. Amanda Ripley's search for her mother brings her to the isolated halls of the Sevastopol Space Station, where numerous threats run amok, from the unsettling androids to the iconic and terrifying Xenomorph.

Amanda gains access to her fair share of weapons to make things easier for herself against the myriad of foes standing in her way. However, this survival horror's solid ranged combat can only take players so far. A single encounter against the game's dreaded Xenomorph will make it clear that some threats can only be evaded, not destroyed.

4 The Typing Of The Dead

A Unique Rail Shooter Where Players Type Out Words To Take Out Zombies

  • Platforms: Arcade, Dreamcast, PC, PlayStation 2
  • Release Year: 1999
  • Developer : WOW Entertainment
  • Genre(s) : Survival Horror, Educational

One of the funniest Sega games of all time that fans can't get enough of, The Typing of the Dead was an imaginative port of The House of the Dead where players had to type words to destroy zombies. It was a wacky gameplay loop that surprisingly worked — especially given how novel this port was.

Seeing the main characters carry keyboards around to deal with zombies is hilarious and never gets old. Players who want to take out the undead and improve their typing speed will have a great time with The Typing of the Dead .

3 Panzer Dragoon Orta

The Pinnacle Of Panzer Dragoon's Rail Shooter Gameplay

Panzer Dragoon is one of the most popular Sega franchises around, with one of its entries standing out as a JRPG that fans adore. However, the series is predominantly known as a rail shooter, and Panzer Dragoon Orta refines this gameplay to near perfection.

Controlling Orta and her dragon as players take out numerous enemies and bosses is a huge part of what makes Panzer Dragoon Orta so special. Players who love quality rail shooters will have a blast with this title as they try to get through all ten levels.

2 Aliens Vs Predator

Controlling The Marines Turns The Game Into A Traditional First-Person Shooter

Aliens Vs Predator is one of the most ambitious video games Sega has published, letting players take on the role of an Alien, Marine, or Predator. All three factions play differently and add a ton of flavor to the gameplay.

If players take on the role of a Marine, then the title turns into a competent FPS that's so fun to play through. Gunning down waves of foes with squadmates is a blast as players go through the title's stellar campaign.

1 Virtua Cop 2

A Beloved Rail Shooter And One Of The Most Legendary Sega Games

Virtua Cop is a series of legendary rail shooters that need no introduction. Most people are aware of Virtua Cop 2 , the most well-known and beloved title in the series full of tense gameplay as players strive to take out criminals and save hostages.

Players must have lightning-quick reflexes to take out the many foes that stand in their way without making any mistakes. Given this title's arcade roots, Virtua Cop 2 can be ridiculously hard, which is why it's a genuine achievement to get past the game's many challenging levels.

item.title: Xbox Console Exclusive Mecha BREAK Confirms Release Window
item.description:
Summary

  • Mecha BREAK will launch on Xbox Series X|S and PC simultaneously in spring 2025.
  • The PlayStation 5 version of Mecha BREAK is planned for release later in 2025.
  • Xbox has been providing support to the developers at Amazing Seasun Games for features like cross-play and cross-saves.

China-based studio Amazing Seasun Games confirmed that multiplayer third-person shooter Mecha BREAK will release in spring 2025 as an Xbox Series X|S console exclusive. Mecha BREAK is the studio's first console game, and more details involving the game's Xbox console exclusivity were revealed.

Mecha BREAK was initially announced at The Game Awards 2023 with an action-packed reveal trailer. Nearly half a year after the reveal, the Mecha BREAK Xbox Series X|S beta test was held in August 2024, and Mecha BREAK surpassed a million wishlists on Steam as one of the most popular upcoming releases at that time. This past December, Mecha BREAK also received a new update at The Game Awards 2024, which confirmed the 2025 release window with a new trailer. In Mecha BREAK's first update of the new year, the developers confirmed new details about the game's Xbox exclusivity.

Amazing Seasun Games confirmed the release window for Mecha BREAK is now set for spring 2025, and the game will be a console launch exclusive on Xbox Series X|S. The PC versions will also be available day-and-date for Steam and Windows via the Xbox app, according to the game's official Facebook account. The game is planned for release on "more platforms" later in the year, with a subsequent comment by the Facebook account confirming that Mecha BREAK will come to PlayStation 5. In addition, Amazing Seasun Games revealed that developers from Xbox are providing support for Mecha BREAK's development to ensure features like cross-play and cross-save functionality are available on day one. It's unclear whether the cross-play and cross-save support will be available with the PlayStation 5 version later this year, however.

Mecha BREAK Will Launch in Spring 2025 as an Xbox Series X|S Console Exclusive

  • Mecha BREAK will be available on Xbox Series X|S and PC day-and-date.
  • The PlayStation 5 version is still planned for release later in 2025.

Some fans who previously played the Mecha BREAK open beta were happy about the update, while others shared feedback on potential improvements before the game's launch. One of the fan requests involves the removal of bots to ensure a true PvP experience. In the beta, bots were used to fill up empty slots in teams before a match begins.

As shown in one of Mecha BREAK's previous gameplay trailers, the game will feature three modes with ground and aerial combat, including "3v3 Deathmatch," "6v6 Hero Shooter," and "PvPvE Extraction Shooter" modes. In the extraction mode, players can team up and form three-man squads to survive mech battles in a vast 200-square-kilometer combat area. Players on Xbox Series X|S and PC will be able to earn loot and special materials for their mechs, which are fully customizable with a selection of weapons, parts, paint jobs, and much more. Leading up to the PlayStation 5 version's release, Mecha BREAK is expected to receive multiple post-launch updates.

item.title: Palworld: All Tower Bosses in Order and Their Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Zoe & Grizzbolt
  • Lily & Lyleen
  • Axel & Orserk
  • Marcus & Faleris
  • Victor & Shadowbeak
  • Saya & Selyne
  • Bjorn & Bastigor
  • Best Order To Defeat Palworld Tower Bosses

Palworld is primarily a survival-crafting RPG where players can capture and tame animal-like creatures called “Pals.” As they explore Palpagos Island and upgrade their base, players will quickly realize that the world is full of dangers. If they want to survive, players must be prepared to do anything.

The main antagonists in Palworld take the form of powerful Tower Bosses. The island is divided into various factions, and each one has its own Tower Boss. All of these bosses have unique strengths and weaknesses and demand different approaches in battle. Keep reading to learn the best order to defeat Tower Bosses in Palworld and their locations.

Updated on February 11, 2025, by Nathan Round: Palworld is constantly receiving new updates, from the introduction of Raid Bosses to the addition of new Pal species. However, the most anticipated updates are world expansions, introducing entirely new islands to explore. This guide now includes Bjorn & Bastigor, the new Tower Boss added in the Feybreak update.

Zoe & Grizzbolt

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

112, -431

Electric

Ground

Zoe and Grizzbolt are the first Tower Boss players will encounter in Palworld . Players will find Zoe and Grizzbolt at the Rayne Syndicate Tower , located in the Windswept Hills region. For players looking to take on both Zoe and Grizzbolt, it is recommended to reach level 15 to acquire useful tech in preparation for the fight. At this level range, players can get their hands on Pelt Armor , which works well in adding some much-needed defense points.

Since Grizzbolt is an Electric-type Pal, players can use Ground Pals to exploit their weaknesses . Rushoar and Fuddler are two great early-game Ground Pals for this boss fight to consider, dealing good damage with each attack. Weapon-wise, players can opt for the Fire Arrow Crossbow to deal fire damage over time, though they will need to stock up on Flame Organs from Foxparks and other Pals to craft a decent ammo supply.

Lily & Lyleen

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

183, 31

Grass

Fire

Lily and Lyleen can be found inside the Tower of the Free Pal Alliance , located in the Frostbound Mountains — one of the more beautiful locations in Palworld . Players aiming to defeat Lily and Lyleen should be at least level 25 or higher , as this will allow them to craft Metal Armor for increased health and defense, and access other useful tech for the battle.

Lyleen is a Grass-type Pal, making her vulnerable to fire attacks . However, while players might initially lean toward using Fire Pals, Lily, and Lyleen employ Water-based attacks, which Fire Pals are weak against. Players should instead have a Pal that has been given Fire-based attacks using Skill Tree Fruit and withdraw any Fire Pals when Lyleen uses Water attacks . Recommended Skill Fruits include Ignis Blast, Spirit Fire, and Flare Arrow. A good Pal for this fight is Vanwyrm Cryst , effective for freezing enemies. For Fire Pals, Vanwyrm , Wixen , and Wixen Noct are solid choices. Weapons-wise, players can opt for the Musket and a Makeshift Handgun.

Axel & Orserk

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

-588, -518

Electric/Dragon

Ground and Ice

Axel and Orserk can be found in the Tower of the Brothers of the Eternal Pyre , deep within the center of Mount Obsidian. Since this area is located within Mount Obsidian, players will need to wear heat-protecting gear to venture over without taking damage. For Axel and Orserk specifically, Heat Resistant Refined Metal Armor will work well. It’s also recommended that players reach at least level 40 before taking on Axel and Orserk.

Orserk is an Electric and Dragon-type Pal, meaning that players should opt for Ground and Ice-type Pals to exploit Orserk’s weaknesses. Pals like Anubis and Warsect are excellent choices. Dumud can also be a valuable addition to the party, even without being summoned, as it boosts the power of other Ground Pals. Weapon-wise, a Handgun of Rare rarity or higher will work well, along with an alternative like a Double Barrel Shotgun.

Marcus & Faleris

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

558, 333

Fire

Water

Marcus and Faleris can be found hidden in the Tower of the PIDF , located on the far east side of the Dessicated Desert. Since this boss fight takes place in the Dessicated Desert, players will need armor that raises heat resistance. The Heat Resistant Refined Metal Armor is a good choice for this fight, as it also offers improved defense. It's also recommended that players reach about level 45 before taking on Marcus and Faleris.

Since Faleris is a Fire-type Pal, players should bring their best Water-type Pals to exploit Marcus and Faleris's weaknesses. Some great Pals to consider include Jormuntide and Azurobe . Adding Gobfin to the team can also be a great pick, as it increases the player's damage. Weapons-wise, a good rarity Assault Rifle should work well, with a Pump-Action Shotgun as a solid backup option.

Victor & Shadowbeak

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

-147, 446

Dark

Dragon

Victor and Shadowbeak are the final Tower Bosses included with the launch of Palworld . They can be found at the Tower of the PAL Genetic Research Unit , deep within the Astral Mountains. Before heading here, players will need to acquire armor that raises cold resistance, such as Cold Resistant Pal Metal Armor , which also provides added protection. It is also suggested that players reach level 50 before taking on the challenge.

Shadowbeak is a Dark-type Pal with a large health pool, so players need to be well-prepared, and utilize Dragon-type Pals in battle . Some great Pals to consider include Jetragon and Jormuntide Ignis . However, players should be sure to pull back their Dragon Pals when Victor and Shadowbeak perform their Ice attacks. A Chillet with the Swift Passive Trait can also be a good addition, as when mounted, all player attacks will inflict Dragon damage. Weapons-wise, an Assault Rifle of Rare rarity or higher should do just fine, along with a Rocket Launcher for high damage.

Saya & Selyne

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

-595, 203

Dark/Neutral

Dark and Dragon

Saya and Selyne are the Tower Bosses to arrive in Palworld's Sakurajima update. They can be found at the Moonflower Tower , located towards the center of Sakurajima Island. Players who have not yet accessed Sakurajima can do so by using either a flying mount or a water mount to reach the island.

For those looking to challenge Saya & Selyne, it is recommended to first reach Level 55 and equip solid armor, such as Plasteel Armor, along with acquiring powerful weapons like the Rocket Launcher. Saya & Selyne are generally weak against Dark and Dragon Pals , making Jetragon and Astegon good choices. Raid Bosses like Blazamut Ryu and Bellanoir Libero are also quite effective against Saya & Selyne.

Bjorn & Bastigor

Coordinates

Pal Type

Pal Weakness

-1296, -1668

Ice

Fire

The latest Tower Bosses to arrive in Palworld are Bjorn and Bastigor , debuting with the Feybreak Island update. Bjorn and Bastigor can be found in Feybreak Tower , located in the southernmost region of the island: Frozen Coral Hill. The area is extremely cold, making high-resistance armor like Cold Resistant Hexolite Armor essential before heading in.

However, before players can take on Bjorn and Bastigor, they must first collect bounties from three specific Alpha Pals: Dazzi Noct, Caprity Noct, and Omascul. Each of these Alpha Pals can be found within the Frozen Coral Hill, and their bounties can be collected by either defeating them or capturing them. Here is a quick rundown of their locations:

Alpha Pal

Where To Find Them

Map Location (Coordinates)

Dazzi Noct

Northwest of the Feybreak Tower.

-1343, -1579

Caprity Noct

To the east of the Feybreak Tower.

-1163, -1652

Omascul

At the eastern side of the Frozen Coral Hill.

-1183, -1490

Recommended weapons for this boss fight include the Plasma Cannon, Laser Gatling Gun, or even the Flamethrower to exploit Bastigor's elemental weakness. Bastigor is weak to Fire Pals , so players should bring their strongest Fire-type allies. Top choices include Blazamut , Blazamut Ryu, Jormuntide Ignis , and Wixen , with the last option being able to enhance player attacks with fire damage.

Best Order To Defeat Palworld Tower Bosses

There are seven Tower Bosses that players can defeat in Palworld . Whenever they start a Tower Boss Fight, players will only get ten minutes to defeat the enemy . The best order to battle these bosses is to go from the one with the lowest HP to the highest. Here is a quick breakdown of the best order to defeat each Tower Boss in Palworld :

Order

Boss

HP

1

Zoe & Grizzbolt

30,550

2

Lily & Lyleen

69,375

3

Axel & Orserk

130,700

4

Marcus & Faleris

146,975

5

Victor & Shadowbeak

200,750

6

Saya & Selyne

261,000

7

Bjorn & Bastigor

509,249

item.title: Accidental Win - Evading Capture!
item.description: Players score accidental wins in Search and Destroy and more.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure: How To Unlock More Visitors (Friends and Family Quest)
item.description:
Hello Kitty Island Adventure has many different characters from the Sanrio franchise that players can unlock. While a lot of them are already on the island when the players land, some are lost in other biomes that the players have to go and find. Still others like Dear Daniel have to be unlocked separately through the help of My Melody.

Players will be able to unlock some more visitors to the island, which will allow them to interact with even more beloved characters from the Hello Kitty franchise, including her boyfriend, in Hello Kitty Island Adventure . Here's how to do so by completing the "Friends and Family" quest.

How To Unlock Visitors

Those who have already played the game a bit, completed some quests, and earned some friendship with My Melody will log in to find her need to speak with the player. She will then take the player across the bridge she built in a previous quest and show off some cabins that look like the player's home.

After the player sees the cabin, My Melody will tell the player that they need to put some furniture in it that the desired visitor will enjoy. After the player completes each furniture item, it will be checked with a green check mark.

Players will want to note that these are just visitor characters , which makes them separate from the permanent island characters. This means that players will raise their friendship with them a bit differently, including completing a daily quest that they want the player to do. Friendship with visitor characters is measured in stars, and will only allow players to max it out once it reaches 5. Below is a chart for each visitor that is possible to get in the game, the items that need to be in the cabin, and what their 5 quests will be.

Visitor

Cabin Requirements

Daily Quest

Dear Daniel

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near Hello Kitty
  • Three pieces of furniture
  • A Mama's Apple Pie

  • Bushels of Love
  • Apple of My Eye
  • Classic Apple Pie
  • Dream of Apple Pie
  • Amazing Apple Pie

Mimmy

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near Hello Kitty
  • Two bakery items
  • Five pieces of Hello Kitty furniture

  • Embroidery
  • Fascinating Fabric
  • Shopping for Clothes
  • Joyful Outfit
  • Material Girl

My Melody's Mama

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near My Melody
  • Three pieces of cottage furniture
  • Three pink items
  • Three sweet items

  • Sandy Currency
  • Bedtime Reading
  • Tropical Materials
  • Soda Treat
  • Tropical Trinket

My Melody's Papa

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near My Melody
  • Three plant items
  • Three healthy items

  • Gooey Pineapple Treat
  • Bubbly Banana Soda
  • Spicy Pizza Time
  • Tropical Fishing Break
  • Overloaded Everything Pizza

My Melody's Grandma

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near My Melody
  • Must have three cottage items
  • Must have three creative items

  • Grandma's Closet
  • Reading the Classics
  • Fabulous Fabrics
  • Sugary Snacktime
  • Surprise Gift

My Melody's Grandpa

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near My Melody
  • Three rocky items
  • Three volcanic items
  • Three metal items

  • Refreshing Ice Hike
  • Built Different
  • Hot Shots
  • Fiery Tunes
  • Cloud Jumping

Azuki

  • Must have every piece of yummy furniture

  • A Grande Visit
  • Sakura Sensation
  • Spice Things Up
  • Chocolate Treat
  • Delicious Pink Latte

Cappuccino

  • Two bakery items
  • Two cozy beverage items
  • Two pizza items
  • Two soda items

  • Island Flavors: Getting Started
  • Island Flavors: Soda Station
  • Island Flavors: Pizza Oven
  • Island Flavors: Desserts
  • Island Flavors: Chef's Choice

Chiffon

  • Coastal Decorative Plant from Seaside Resort
  • Spooky Lounge Sofa from the Spooky Swamp
  • Pirate Chest Dresser from the Rainbow Reef
  • Tropical Bed from Mount Hothead

  • Swampy Excursion
  • Mountainous Expedition
  • Volcanic Voyage
  • Aquatic Ambience
  • Ice Climbing

Espresso

  • Three Music items
  • Three bookshelves

  • My Friend Cinnamoroll
  • Cinnamon Forever
  • Hot Chocolate
  • Chocolate Chai
  • Selfie Friends

Mocha

  • Two cozy beverage items
  • Must have five pieces of clothing on display

  • Visiting Fashionista
  • Fancy Flowers
  • Ribbon Collection
  • Fruity Snack Break
  • Chocolatey Snack Break

Berry

  • Five spooky items
  • Three joke items
  • Sweet items

  • Chocolate Balls
  • Wiggly, Jiggly Pudding
  • Carbonated Concoction
  • Suspiciously Trendy Coffee
  • Cheesy Delivery

Cherry

  • Five spooky items
  • Three fancy items
  • Two pink items

  • Marshy Makeover
  • Cute Little Rascal
  • Phantom Express
  • The Ol' Switcheroo
  • Ocean Floor Decor

Baku

  • Must be in Spooky Swamp to be near Kuromi
  • Five pieces of spooky celebration furniture

  • Swamp Patrol
  • Keep It Moving
  • Lifeguard on Duty
  • Funny Fishman
  • Lead Into Action

Tam

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near Tuxedosam
  • One piece of sunshine celebration
  • Must have five pieces of clothing on display

  • Tropical Eats
  • Tropical Treats
  • Tropical Attire
  • Tropical Lifestyle
  • Tropical Family

Pam

  • Must be in Seaside Resort to be near Tuxedosam
  • Five pieces of Fwish furniture
  • Must have one piece of clothing on display

  • Fish Me Well
  • Part Fish Friend
  • Whole Fish Friend
  • Teach a Pam to Fish
  • On The Scale of Rarity

Each visitor will also help progress the plot, meaning players will unlock quests with the visitors coming to live in the cabins for a short time. Visitors won't stay on the island forever; instead they will have traveling time. Each one is different, especially each time they come and go. For example, Dear Daniel came on the 2nd of February and will leave on the 11th. They will return for some time.

The best thing to do overall is to decorate the cabins in a way that can be fitted for multiple of the visitors listed above, since there are only so many cabins in each location. If the cabin doesn't have the required items within it, visitors won't come and stay. So it is better to come up with a design that will fit two or even three of the visitors.
